content: @WG-prioritization let's start the pre-triage
The triage meeting will happen in #t-compiler/meetings > [weekly meeting] 2020-06-04 #54818
I have created the agenda we will be building during this meeting
first, I propose that this is the last meeting and we move to an async process :)
but let's get things started for this last time :)
running the script, it's compiling :)

Unprioritized I-prioritize

  1. All unprioritized I-prioritize

    - Add T-compiler or libs-impl tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

  • "dylib shared libraries will not make public symbols that may be necessary to link inlined code" #65610 labels=[A-linkage | C-bug | I-prioritize | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[pnkfelix]
  • "As of 1.37.0, dylib shared libraries no longer support interpositioning of functions defined in C" #66265 labels=[A-linkage | C-bug | I-prioritize | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  1. T-compiler

    - Prioritize issues and remove nomination of the ones not worth discussing.
    - Tag regressions accordingly.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.

Issues

  • "dylib shared libraries will not make public symbols that may be necessary to link inlined code" #65610 labels=[A-linkage | C-bug | I-prioritize | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[pnkfelix]
  • "As of 1.37.0, dylib shared libraries no longer support interpositioning of functions defined in C" #66265 labels=[A-linkage | C-bug | I-prioritize | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  1. libs-impl

    - Prioritize issues and remove nomination of the ones not worth discussing.
    - Tag regressions accordingly.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.

Issues

Empty
we have those two pending issue to prioritize
on their threads I have proposed those to be P-medium
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/I-prioritize.20.2366265.20As.20of.201.2E37.2E0.2C.20.60dylib.60.20shared.20libraries.20n
and
https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/227806-t-compiler.2Fwg-prioritization/topic/I-prioritize.20.2365610.20.60dylib.60.20shared.20libraries.20will.20not.20make.20p
thoughts about that?
I think P-medium should be fine for the second one
ok, let's go with that for that one ...
Don't know about the first one, there seem to be some people who are blocked by that issue
so maaaaaybe P-high
yeah I'm not 100% sure
to me P-medium / P-high
cc @pnkfelix
let's mark that one as P-high and when Felix have time to check we can change the priority in case he thinks it should be different
They seem very similar to me so I think I'd personally go with P-medium for both but that's just a suggestion.
ok, let's do P-medium given that I'm a bit more towards P-medium too
ok, done
let's move on

Regressions

  1. Beta regressions without P-label

    - Prioritize.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
    - Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.

Issues

Empty

  1. Nightly regressions without P-label

    - Prioritize.
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
    - Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.

Issues

Empty

  1. Stable regressions without P-label

    - Prioritize (once we have this under control).
    - Ping appropriate people and/or ICE-breakers.
    - Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.

Issues

  • "Performance regression on nightly (when using Cursor::read_exact and Byteorder)" #47321 labels=[C-enhancement | I-slow | T-libs | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  • "Performance regression in tight loop since rust 1.25" #53340 labels=[I-slow | T-libs | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  • "regression in compilation times on 1.31.0-nightly (4bd4e4130 2018-10-25)" #55390 labels=[C-bug | E-needs-bisection | E-needs-mcve | I-compiletime | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  • "Regression: Not well-formed HRTB doesn't compile" #55498 labels=[A-traits | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]

  • "include_dir rustdoc segfault" #56900 labels=[A-macros | C-bug | I-compilemem | I-compiletime | T-compiler | T-rustdoc | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]

  • "Type mismatching cased by duplicate associated type resolution" #59326 labels=[A-typesystem | C-bug | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  • "Optimization regression in 1.32+" #59352 labels=[I-slow | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  • "regression: doctest failure display-as-0.4.4" #61562 labels=[T-rustdoc | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  • "use Trait::{}; acts as use Trait;" #61826 labels=[A-resolve | C-bug | T-compiler | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[petrochenkov]
  • "1.65x performance regression from 1.35.0 to 1.36.0" #62439 labels=[I-slow | T-compiler | T-libs | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
  • "rustdoc only: duplicate lang item panic_halt" #68427 labels=[A-lang-item | C-bug | T-rustdoc | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[GuillaumeGomez]
  • "Ungreat change to doctest test names" #70090 labels=[A-doctests | A-macros | C-bug | I-nominated | T-rustdoc | regression-from-stable-to-stable] assignees=[]
no unprioritized nightly and beta regressions as expected per our procedure
and we have some stable to stable ones, let's continue tagging 4 with I-prioritize
17 right now, we are close :)
well, I'd need to re-check this because we shouldn't be looking for T-libs
going to tag with I-prioritize the ones that are for us and fix the script to filter only for T-compiler and libs-impl
ok, done
it would be nice if we check if the T-libs stable to stable regressions shouldn't be libs-impl, before I changed the filter
let's continue ...

I-nominated

  1. All I-nominated

    - Add T-compiler or libs-impl tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

  • "Tracking issue for DST coercions (coerce_unsized, unsize) stabilization" #27732 labels=[A-coercions | A-dst | B-RFC-implemented | B-unstable | C-tracking-issue | I-nominated | T-lang | T-libs] assignees=[]
  • "doctests marked with 'no_run' permit ICEs" #49514 labels=[C-bug | I-nominated | T-rustdoc] assignees=[]
  • "rustdoc disregards job limit" #53143 labels=[A-doctests | A-libtest | I-nominated | T-rustdoc] assignees=[]
  • "Arc::drop has a (potentially) dangling shared ref" #55005 labels=[C-bug | I-nominated | I-unsound :boom: | P-medium | T-lang | T-libs] assignees=[]
  • "f32 formatter produces strange results" #63171 labels=[C-bug | I-nominated | T-libs] assignees=[]
  • "COPYRIGHT file is wildly out of date" #63232 labels=[I-nominated | P-high | T-core] assignees=[]
  • "Tracking issue for RFC 2523, #[cfg(version(..))]" #64796 labels=[B-RFC-approved | C-tracking-issue | F-cfg_version | I-nominated | T-lang] assignees=[rustbot]

  • "Stabilize transmute in constants and statics but not const fn" #72920 labels=[I-nominated | S-waiting-on-review | T-lang | relnotes] assignees=[RalfJung]
there's nothing to do there

1. I-nominated T-compiler

    - Remove leftovers from last meeting.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

gonna check if we've discussed this in last meeting
we didn't

same here, we only discussed LLVM stuff during last meeting

PR's waiting for on team

  1. All PR's waiting on team

    - Add T-compiler or libs-impl tag when it corresponds.
    - Do a sanity check on them.

Issues

  • "Perform WF-check on types with no type parameters" #69741 labels=[I-nominated | S-waiting-on-team | T-lang] assignees=[varkor]

added T-compiler to #72541

1. PR's waiting on T-compiler

    - Explicitly nominate any that you think may be able to be resolved quickly in triage meeting.

I'd need to spend some time reviewing this, help is more than welcome here :)
#71858 is in FCP, disposition to merge
#72603 is already nominated :)
#72541 seems to need some kind of discussion
going to nominate for now, unsure what do people think about it ...

1. PR's waiting on libs-impl

    - Explicitly nominate any that you think may be able to be resolved quickly in triage meeting.

Issues

Empty
ok, script has prepared the agenda

Santiago Pastorino said:

#72541 seems to need some kind of discussion

I think this needs discussion from some people with LLVM knowledge. It sounds like eddyb is saying supporting SPIR-V isn't viable so we shouldn't take this patch regardless.
yeah but I wonder if that suits a nomination or if we won't have people with that knowledge
maybe it's good to nominate, note that and perhaps the discussion is about raising aware that we need to ping someone ?
I think it's good to nominate
To bring it onto the rest of the team's radar
:+1:
have just pasted the agenda
there are things to tidy up :)
I can do that I guess
and I'm again confirming that this meeting doesn't make sense anymore :)
I'm explicitly saying anymore because this made sense in the past but that's not true anymore due to our automations
which is exactly what we were looking for, so yay!!
again, I can promise to make a proposal about an async way of working
but we need some more automations
would be nice if someone is willing to hack some of those automations ;) ;) ;)
those are relatively easy because most of our infrastructure is already there
anyway, if someone wants/can please ping me
let's move to the last part ...

Announcements

  • Check the compiler calendar to see if there's an outstanding event to announce.
    • Add those to the agenda properly linking issues and documents.
we have a planning meeting on friday
and the release :)
happens tomorrow
yep
those interested can follow the thread in #t-release (yeh we are on zulip now)
:tada:
cool, let's move on

Nominate issues

Check how packed the agenda looks like and if there's room for more, consider the following ...

  • All Stable-to-beta regressions
    • Check if there are relevant issues that are worth raising awareness.
    • Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
  • All Stable-to-nightly regressions
    • Check if there are relevant issues that are worth raising awareness.
    • Assign if possible; if it remains unassigned, add it to agenda so we can assign during the meeting.
  • P-high issues
    • unassigned
the agenda is really packed

Toolstate

  • Check toolstate for outstanding tool breakage.
    • Notify teams in the corresponding channels
clippy-driver is failing
cc @DPC
btw, would be nice if toolstate has another column that says which ones block stable releases and which ones doesn't
iirc this won't affect tomorrow's release so we can skip it
@DPC do you think it's feasible to add that information there?
also that looks odd because clippy was fixed last week (i'll investigate it)
sounds good to me, i'll check with @simulacrum

Performance regressions

  • Check perf regressions.
    • Notify involved actors.
well this part of the script is a bit old
let's check perf anyway
there doesn't seem to be anything
ok, gonna fix the agenda
but I think we can say this meeting is over
:wave:
we can continue discussing async if people wants
@WG-prioritization the agenda is ready but this section could be improved
if someone wants to help me add some text that explain why things are nominated would be great
@Wesley Wiser cool :)
should we split? or should we list them one by one here and comment?
@Wesley Wiser I'm not sure about the backtrace nomination though
maybe that one shouldn't even be nominated
also
about #72730, what did you mean by (this is an issue) ?

Santiago Pastorino said:

Wesley Wiser I'm not sure about the backtrace nomination though

maybe cc @Jonas Schievink
There's previously been some confusion in the meeting when there are issues nominated for dicussion
I just thought it would be helpful to call out this is an issue not a PR

Santiago Pastorino said:

maybe cc Jonas Schievink
